thread.title: NYSE to Pay $14 Million Over 2015 Trading Malfunctions

author: Dave Michaels
title: NYSE to Pay $14 Million Over 2015 Trading Malfunctions
text:
The New York Stock Exchange agreed Tuesday to pay $14 million to settle regulatory investigations into a series of market malfunctions and technical errors that disrupted trading on three occasions in 2015.
The settlement represents the first case in which the Securities and Exchange Commission accused a stock exchange of violating rules established to prevent outages of critical market infrastructure. The SEC also faulted NYSE for using unapproved “price collars” to damp price swings during a wild trading session on Aug.... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
